Creating new instances of SimpleDateFormat every time you need to format a date can get very expensive. You can fix this by only creating one instance and sharing it, but then you run into another problem - SimpleDateFormat is not threadsafe. Both of these problems are solveable, but this is why we recommend using android.text.format.DateFormat.format(...) method instead for simple formatting. I promise that it works fine.
